Table of Contents

Class TextInputSource

Namespace
osu.Framework.Input
Assembly
osu.Framework.dll

A source from which we can retrieve user text input. Generally hides a native implementation from the game framework.

public class TextInputSource

Properties

ImeActive

Whether IME is actively providing text composition through OnImeComposition and accepting input from the user.

public bool ImeActive { get; }

Property Value

bool

Methods

Activate(bool, RectangleF)

Activates this TextInputSource. User text input can be acquired through OnTextInput, OnImeComposition and OnImeResult.

public void Activate(bool allowIme, RectangleF imeRectangle)

Parameters

allowIme bool

Whether input using IME should be allowed.

imeRectangle RectangleF

Rough location of where the text will be input, so the native implementation can adjust virtual keyboards and IME popups.

Remarks

Each Activate(bool, RectangleF) must be followed by a Deactivate().

ActivateTextInput(bool)

Activates the native implementation that provides text input. Should be overriden per-platform.

protected virtual void ActivateTextInput(bool allowIme)

Parameters

allowIme bool

Whether input using IME should be allowed.

Remarks

An active native implementation should call TriggerTextInput(string) on new text input and forward IME composition events through TriggerImeComposition(string, int, int) and TriggerImeResult(string).

Deactivate()

Deactivates this TextInputSource.

public void Deactivate()

Remarks

Should be called once text input is no longer needed. Each Deactivate() must be preceded by an Activate(bool, RectangleF).

DeactivateTextInput()

Deactivates the native implementation that provides text input. Should be overriden per-platform.

protected virtual void DeactivateTextInput()

EnsureActivated(bool, RectangleF?)

Ensures that the native implementation that retrieves user text input is activated and that the user can start entering text.

public void EnsureActivated(bool allowIme, RectangleF? imeRectangle = null)

Parameters

allowIme bool

Whether input using IME should be allowed.

imeRectangle RectangleF?

Rough location of where the text will be input, so the native implementation can adjust virtual keyboards and IME popups. Can be null to avoid changing the IME rectangle.

EnsureTextInputActivated(bool)

Ensures that the native implementation that retrieves user text input is activated and that the user can start entering text.

protected virtual void EnsureTextInputActivated(bool allowIme)

Parameters

allowIme bool

Whether input using IME should be allowed.

Remarks

Only called if the native implementation has been activated with Activate(bool, RectangleF).

ResetIme()

Resets IME. This clears the current composition string and prepares it for new input.

public virtual void ResetIme()

SetImeRectangle(RectangleF)

Sets where the native implementation displays IME controls and other text input elements.

public virtual void SetImeRectangle(RectangleF rectangle)

Parameters

rectangle RectangleF

Should be provided in screen space.

TriggerImeComposition(string, int, int) 

protected void TriggerImeComposition(string text, int start, int length)

Parameters

text string
start int
length int

TriggerImeResult(string) 

protected void TriggerImeResult(string text)

Parameters

text string

TriggerTextInput(string) 

protected void TriggerTextInput(string text)

Parameters

text string

Events

OnImeComposition

Invoked when IME composition starts or changes.

public event TextInputSource.ImeCompositionDelegate OnImeComposition

Event Type

TextInputSource.ImeCompositionDelegate

Remarks

Empty string for text means that the composition has been cancelled.

OnImeResult

Invoked when IME composition successfully completes.

public event Action<string> OnImeResult

Event Type

Action<string>

OnTextInput

Invoked on text input.

public event Action<string> OnTextInput

Event Type

Action<string>
